name: Talus Bio
headline: Discovering drugs that target the DNA regulome
description: We have built a platform that enables drug discovery and development for previously undruggable genome regulators ("the regulome"). We accomplish this by moving drug discovery out of artificial systems where regulome proteins fail to function properly, and back into live human cells. Our technology combines innovations in automated cell processing, next-gen proteomics, and advanced data analytics to measure a drug's effect on the entire regulome in one experiment.

founders.name: Alex Federation, Founder
founders.description: I'm the co-founder of Talus Bio. Prior to Talus, I trained with Jay Bradner at Harvard in medicinal chemistry, drug screening, and drug development for gene regulators. After that, I moved to Seattle to continue my training in epigenomics and proteomics, and these were all combined to develop the Talus gene regulator platform.

founders.name: Lindsay Pino, Founder
founders.description: I'm Talus Bio's CTO, where my focus is on developing techniques for quantitative proteomics and in particular the challenges associated with scaling-up quantitative proteomics experiments. I’ve trained at the Broad Institute, the University of Washington, and most recently the University of Pennsylvania.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Talus Bio**

Founded in 2020 and located in Seattle, WA, Talus Bio is at the forefront of biotechnology, specifically focused on drug discovery that targets the DNA regulome—essentially, the regulatory elements of our genome. With a mission to reinvent how we approach “undruggable” genomic regulators, Talus Bio has effectively moved drug discovery from artificial environments back into living human cells. This method ensures that the functions of regulome proteins are accurately assessed, enabling a deeper understanding of how drugs can modify their actions.

**Technology and Innovations**

Talus Bio has developed an impressive platform called MARMOT, which stands out for its ability to target previously "undruggable" transcription factors in their native cellular contexts. By combining cutting-edge automated cell processing, next-gen proteomics, and advanced data analytics, the platform can evaluate a drug's impact on the entire regulome within a single experiment. This is particularly significant for addressing complex diseases like cancer and diabetes, where therapeutic options are often limited.

**Team and Ecosystem**

The Talus Bio team consists of 16 employees who are dedicated to pushing the boundaries of drug development in challenging therapeutic areas. They were also a part of the Y Combinator Batch S21, which is a testament to their innovative approach and potential for growth. Jared Friedman serves as their Group Partner, providing strategic guidance.

**Current Initiatives and Community Engagement**

On their website, you can explore various sections detailing their technology, research pipeline, and recent publications. They also share updates on staffing changes and new initiatives, including a blog that addresses drugging the undruggable. By fostering a culture of openness and innovation, Talus Bio aims to bridge gaps in the healthcare landscape, so no target feels insurmountable.

To learn more about their technology and vision, visit their website at [Talus Bio](https://www.talus.bio). 

In the grand scheme, what Talus Bio is doing is not just about creating drugs—it's challenging the very notion of what's possible in biotechnology. With the right tools and mindset, they believe that nothing is truly "undruggable."
